Stem: People who regularly drink tea report lower levels of stress, on average, than those who do not. Give one reason why this might be true, other than drinking tea reducing stress.

RunsThroughA.text: Tea contains chemicals like L-theanine which are known to be calming.
RunsThroughA.explanation: This is A->B. This describes the biological mechanism by which tea reduces stress.

RunsThroughA.text: The warmth of the tea is physically relaxing.
RunsThroughA.explanation: This is A->B. This describes a physical mechanism by which drinking tea reduces stress.

RunsThroughA.text: The ritual of brewing and drinking tea forces you to take a break, which reduces stress.
RunsThroughA.explanation: This is A->Mediator->B. The ritual/break (Mediator) is a direct consequence of drinking tea (A). This relies on the prohibited pathway.

RunsThroughA.text: People drink tea instead of coffee, and less caffeine means less stress.
RunsThroughA.explanation: This is A->Displacement->B. Drinking tea (A) displaces coffee (a stressor), leading to lower stress (B). This relies on A causing the outcome.
